definitions: moving or happening with intense, wild energy and activity
characterized by rapid chaotic movement or excessive frantic activity
examples: The frenetic pace of city life exhausted her
His frenetic movements suggested extreme nervousness
She maintained a frenetic schedule throughout the week
The frenetic trading on Wall Street continued

definitions: showing wild and uncontrolled excitement or energy in behavior
characterized by violent mental agitation or frantic uncontrolled activity
examples: The frenzied crowd pushed toward the stage
Her frenzied attempts to escape were futile
The shark's frenzied attack terrified the swimmers
He worked at a frenzied pace before deadline

definitions: happening or occurring at short intervals or many times
visiting a place regularly or doing something often as habit
examples: Frequent storms disrupted the shipping schedule
She made frequent trips to the library
He was a frequent guest at their home
The restaurant attracts frequent customers with loyalty rewards

definitions: recently produced, made, or harvested; not preserved or frozen
not yet spoiled, decayed or stale; retaining original qualities
new, original, or different from what existed before
pleasantly cool, clean, and invigorating, especially of air or water
showing inappropriate boldness or disrespectful familiarity
examples: The bakery sells fresh bread every morning
Fresh vegetables taste better than frozen ones
Keep the milk fresh by refrigerating it
The fresh fish was caught this morning
She brought fresh ideas to the project
A fresh approach solved the old problem
The fresh mountain air cleared his mind
A fresh breeze cooled the hot afternoon
Don't get fresh with your teacher
His fresh remarks offended several guests

definitions: relating to or being a student in the first year of study
examples: The freshman class elected their representatives
She took several freshman courses this semester
His freshman year proved challenging but rewarding
The freshman orientation lasted three days

definitions: decorated with interlaced or angular designs resembling fretwork patterns
worn away or eroded through constant rubbing or gnawing action
examples: The fretted ceiling displayed intricate geometric patterns
A fretted border decorated the ancient vase
The fretted rope showed signs of dangerous wear
Years of use left the stone steps deeply fretted

definitions: relating to consonant sounds produced by forcing breath through narrow opening
examples: The fricative consonants include f, v, and s
English has several fricative sounds in its phonology
Her fricative pronunciation made certain words hard to understand
The fricative quality distinguished these phonemes

definitions: relating to or produced by the physical force resisting relative motion
arising from conflict, disagreement, or resistance between people or groups
examples: Frictional forces slowed the sliding object
The frictional heat damaged the brake pads
Frictional unemployment occurs during job transitions
Their frictional relationship hampered team productivity

definitions: cooked by immersing in hot oil or fat until crispy
completely exhausted mentally or physically from overwork or stress
examples: The fried chicken was crispy and delicious
She ordered fried rice with her meal
After the long shift, he felt completely fried
My brain is fried from studying all night

definitions: having no friends; lacking companionship or social support
examples: The friendless child ate lunch alone daily
Moving abroad left her temporarily friendless
His hostile behavior made him completely friendless
The friendless elderly man welcomed any visitor

definitions: showing kindness, warmth, and helpfulness toward others
not causing harm or damage; safe for particular use or purpose
describing informal sports match not part of serious competition
examples: The friendly staff made everyone feel welcome
She gave him a friendly smile
This cleaner is environmentally friendly
The software has a user-friendly interface
They played a friendly match before the tournament
The friendly game helped both teams practice

definitions: feeling afraid, scared, or anxious about something dangerous or unpleasant
examples: The frightened child hid behind her mother
Lightning made the frightened dog tremble
She felt frightened walking alone at night
His frightened expression revealed his terror

definitions: making someone feel afraid, scared, or anxious; inducing fear
examples: The frightening movie kept her awake all night
Thunder can be frightening for young children
He told frightening stories around the campfire
The accident statistics are truly frightening

definitions: extremely unpleasant, shocking, or disagreeable in nature or appearance
causing fear or terror; inspiring fright or dread
examples: The frightful weather ruined their vacation plans
What a frightful mess you've made
A frightful scream pierced the night air
The frightful creature emerged from the shadows

definitions: having an extremely cold temperature; frozen or near freezing
showing no friendliness or warmth; emotionally unresponsive or hostile
examples: The frigid Arctic winds cut through their coats
Frigid temperatures kept everyone indoors
Her frigid reception made him feel unwelcome
His frigid manner discouraged conversation

definitions: having a decorative border of hanging threads, cords, or strips
examples: The fringed shawl complemented her outfit perfectly
She wore a fringed leather jacket
The fringed curtains added texture to the room
A fringed lampshade cast interesting shadows

definitions: showing playful energy and liveliness; inclined to frolic or play
examples: The frisky puppy chased its tail endlessly
Frisky kittens tumbled across the floor
She felt frisky after her morning coffee
The frisky colt bucked and pranced

definitions: characterized by lack of seriousness or importance; inappropriately silly
having little weight or importance; not worth serious attention
examples: His frivolous attitude annoyed his serious colleagues
She made frivolous comments during the meeting
They wasted money on frivolous purchases
The court dismissed the frivolous lawsuit

definitions: located at or near the forward part or position
facing toward the front or forward direction
examples: The front door needs a new lock
She sat in the front row
The front windows overlook the garden
He parked in the front driveway

definitions: relating to or located at the front part of something
direct and forceful in approach or confrontation without evasion
examples: The frontal lobe controls important cognitive functions
The frontal view showed the building's facade
They launched a frontal attack on the fortress
Her frontal criticism surprised everyone

definitions: covered with frost or a frost-like coating of ice crystals
having a translucent matte finish that obscures clear vision
examples: The frosted windows sparkled in morning sunlight
Frosted grass crunched underfoot
The bathroom has frosted glass for privacy
She chose frosted nail polish

definitions: having frost; cold enough to produce frost or ice
showing unfriendliness or hostility; cold in manner
examples: The frosty morning air made them shiver
Frosty weather delayed the harvest
She gave him a frosty reception
Their frosty relationship never improved

definitions: changed from liquid to solid state by cold; covered with ice
preserved by freezing at very low temperature for storage
unable to move or react due to fear, shock, or cold
examples: The frozen pond was perfect for skating
Frozen pipes burst during the cold snap
She bought frozen vegetables for convenience
Frozen dinners filled the freezer
He stood frozen with fear
Her frozen expression revealed her shock

definitions: using money and resources carefully and not wastefully; thrifty
examples: Her frugal lifestyle allowed substantial savings
Frugal shoppers compare prices carefully
They prepared a frugal but nutritious meal
His frugal habits came from growing up poor

definitions: producing good or helpful results; productive and beneficial
producing abundant fruit or vegetation; fertile and productive
examples: Their fruitful collaboration produced three patents
The meeting proved fruitful for both parties
The fruitful orchards yielded a record harvest
Fruitful vines covered the arbor

definitions: in the process of producing or bearing fruit
examples: The fruiting trees attracted many birds
Fruiting plants need extra water and nutrients
Scientists studied the fruiting bodies of fungi
The fruiting season varies by climate

definitions: failing to achieve desired results; unproductive or unsuccessful
examples: Their fruitless search lasted for hours
All attempts to contact him proved fruitless
The fruitless negotiations ended in stalemate
Years of fruitless effort discouraged them

definitions: having the taste, smell, or characteristics of fruit
slightly eccentric or unconventional in manner or style
examples: The wine had a fruity flavor with hints of berries
She enjoyed the fruity aroma of the tea
His fruity voice carried across the theater
Her fruity laugh brightened the room

definitions: feeling upset or annoyed due to inability to achieve something
examples: The frustrated student couldn't solve the problem
She felt frustrated by the constant delays
His frustrated attempts led to anger
Frustrated customers complained to management

definitions: causing feelings of upset or annoyance through preventing success
examples: The frustrating delay cost them the contract
Learning a new language can be frustrating
It's frustrating when technology doesn't work properly
The frustrating rules made progress impossible

definitions: damaged beyond repair; completely ruined or not functioning
in serious trouble or difficulty with no easy solution
examples: The engine is completely fucked
My phone is fucked after dropping it
If they find out, we're totally fucked
The company is fucked without new funding

definitions: supplied with fuel for power or energy
stimulated, intensified, or made more active
examples: The diesel-fueled generator provided backup power
Coal-fueled plants produce electricity
Anger fueled his determination to succeed
Coffee-fueled programmers worked through the night

definitions: supplied with fuel for power or energy
stimulated, intensified, or made more active
examples: The petrol-fuelled car needed refilling
Wood-fuelled stoves heated the cabin
Speculation fuelled the market rally
Alcohol-fuelled violence erupted outside

definitions: relating to someone fleeing from law enforcement or captivity
lasting only a short time; fleeting or transitory
examples: The fugitive suspect evaded capture for months
Fugitive slaves sought freedom via underground railroad
She captured fugitive moments of happiness
The fugitive colors faded in sunlight

definitions: feeling satisfied and happy with one's life achievements or situation
examples: She felt fulfilled in her teaching career
A fulfilled life requires meaningful relationships
He seemed fulfilled after completing the project
The fulfilled artist continued creating joyfully

definitions: containing as much or as many as possible; having no empty space
complete with nothing missing; entire or whole
having eaten enough food to feel satisfied
examples: The full glass overflowed when bumped
The parking lot was completely full
She paid the full price without discount
Read the full report before deciding
I'm too full for dessert
He felt full after the large meal

definitions: handling something clumsily or incompetently; lacking coordination or skill
examples: His fumbling attempts to help only made things worse
The fumbling waiter dropped several plates
Her fumbling explanation confused everyone
The team's fumbling performance disappointed fans

definitions: designed to be practical and useful rather than attractive
working or operating properly as intended
examples: The functional design prioritized efficiency over beauty
She preferred functional furniture to decorative pieces
The elevator is functional again after repairs
Only half the computers are functional

definitions: operating or working properly as designed or intended
examples: The functioning equipment needs regular maintenance
All functioning units passed the inspection
A functioning democracy requires informed citizens
The barely functioning car limped home

definitions: forming a necessary base or core; of central importance
examples: Freedom of speech is a fundamental right
Understanding math is fundamental to science
The fundamental problem remains unsolved
They disagreed on fundamental principles

definitions: adhering strictly to fundamental or basic principles of a religion
examples: The fundamentalist preacher opposed modern interpretations
Fundamentalist groups protested the new law
His fundamentalist views alienated moderate members
The fundamentalist movement gained political influence

definitions: provided with money for a particular purpose or project
examples: The fully funded project will begin next month
Government-funded research produced important findings
The funded positions attracted many applicants
Partially funded programs face budget cuts

definitions: relating to or used for funeral ceremonies or burial practices
examples: Ancient funerary rituals revealed cultural beliefs
The funerary urn contained cremated remains
Funerary monuments marked important graves
They studied funerary customs across cultures

definitions: relating to or caused by fungi or fungus organisms
examples: The fungal infection required medical treatment
Fungal spores spread through the air
Scientists studied fungal growth patterns
A fungal disease destroyed the crop

definitions: unconventionally modern and stylish in an interesting way
having a strong, unpleasant smell, especially musty or moldy
examples: She wore a funky vintage dress to the party
The funky music got everyone dancing
Something funky is growing in the refrigerator
These shoes smell pretty funky

definitions: causing laughter or amusement; humorous or entertaining
strange, unusual, or difficult to explain or understand
examples: His funny jokes made everyone laugh
The movie was surprisingly funny
Something funny is going on here
The engine is making a funny noise

definitions: feeling or showing extreme anger; full of fury or rage
very intense, energetic, or rapid in force or movement
examples: She was furious about the broken promise
His furious shouting scared the children
They worked at a furious pace to meet deadline
The furious storm damaged many buildings

definitions: supplied with furniture and other necessary items for living
examples: The furnished apartment included all appliances
They rented a fully furnished house
The nicely furnished office impressed clients
Furnished rooms cost more than unfurnished

definitions: covered with fur or a fur-like coating
examples: The furred animals stayed warm in winter
Small furred creatures scurried through underbrush
His furred tongue indicated dehydration
The furred surface collected dust easily

definitions: marked with deep lines, grooves, or wrinkles, especially from worry
examples: His furrowed brow showed deep concentration
The furrowed field awaited planting
Years of worry left her face deeply furrowed
The furrowed bark provided insect habitat
